title: N.F.L. Week 1 Predictions: Our Picks Against the Spread
text:
The calm before Week 1 of the N.F.L. season is always something to behold. Every team has several breakout candidates. Every coach is either new blood or somehow reinvigorated. Every fan believes his or her team has a lot more winnable games on the schedule than other people might think.

A lot of that enthusiasm will fade by Sunday night, but for now, everyone can bask in the glow of the league having 32 perfect teams.

Here’s a look at N.F.L. Week 1, with all picks made against the point spread.

(If you need a quick primer on how betting lines work, scroll to the bottom of this article.)

Sunday’s Best Games

Rams at Panthers, 1 p.m., Fox

Line: Rams -2.5. Total: 50.

After his awful first season in the N.F.L., it was somewhat reasonable to wonder if Jared Goff was a franchise quarterback or if he had simply been a creation of Sonny Dykes’s offense at Cal. After his third season in the N.F.L., in which he led his team to the Super Bowl, Goff was rewarded with the largest guaranteed contract in N.F.L. history: $110 million.
description: Can the Rams start another Super Bowl run? Will Tom Brady ever get old? Can Jacoby Brissett effectively replace Andrew Luck? The N.F.L. gets ready to answer some questions.
